snippet: Hackers made good on a threat to post the source code for Symantec's popular PCAnywhere antivirus product and threatened to post the remainder of the source code in their possession. Symantec said the hackers offered to stop releasing the company's...
abstract: Hackers made good on a threat to post the source code for Symantec's popular PCAnywhere antivirus product and threatened to post the remainder of the source code in their possession. Symantec said the hackers offered to stop releasing the company's code if they were given money.
lead_paragraph: Hackers made good on a threat to post the source code for Symantec's popular PCAnywhere antivirus product on Monday night and threatened to post the remainder of the Symantec code in their possession on Tuesday. Symantec said the hackers had offered to stop releasing the company's code if they were given money, while the hackers said the company had offered payment first.
